idsDocument.name: Provider
idsDocument.elementOrder: MasterId, PreMergeSurvivor, Type, ActiveFlag, InactiveReason, ExpectedReturnDate, PractitionerCategory, PhotoURL, Person, Educations, Insurances, Languages, Specialities, Licenses, Certifications, Privileges, Credentials, Overrides

changeLog.change: Added Insurances, Specialities, Licenses, Certifications, Privileges, and Credentials
Added SourceStatusCode to instance and collection items.

include.name: CommonElements
include.appendToElementOrder: ExtendedAttributes, SourceStatusCode, SourceCreatedDate, SourceCreatedBy, SourceModifiedDate, SourceModifiedBy

idsDocument.documentation:
Use this IDS to load Provider related information into OmniPatient. A Provider can be a Person or Employee that provides Health Care Services to a Patient.
You may feed both external or internal Providers.

element.name: PreMergeSurvivor
element.documentation:
There are often scenarios in a given source system where multiple instance records may be created that represent the same logical entity. At some point the source system may detect this issue and would like to convey that information to the processing server.
Use this element to indicate the surviving entity when multiple instances represent the same entity. This element will be used during the matching and merging process to insure that entity instances are properly grouped.

element.name: MasterId
element.documentation: Links this instance to the master. This value is created and updated by the Omni matching service.

element.name: Type
element.documentation: Use this element to specify the type of Provider. A provider may be a staff member of the hospital or external.

element.name: ActiveFlag
element.documentation: Use this field to specify the current active state of the Provider.

element.name: InactiveReason
element.documentation: Use this element to specify why the Provider is currently inactive.

element.name: ExpectedReturnDate
element.documentation: Use this element to specify when an inactive Provider is expected to return to active status.

element.name: PractitionerCategory
element.documentation:
Use this element to specify the category of this practitioner. HL-7 allows for the PractitionerCategory (HL7 user-defined table 0186) to be used for this purpose.
Values may include codes for staff physician, courtesy physician, resident, physician assistant, physical therapist, psychiatrist, psychologist, pharmacist, registered nurse, licensed practical nurse, licensed vocational nurse, nurse practitioner, etc.

element.name: PhotoURL
element.documentation: Use this element to specify the URL containing the photo file location.

element.name: Person
element.documentation: Use this element to link or define the Person who is implementing the Provider role within the Health Care Organization.

list.name: Insurances
list.documentation: Use this collection to specify insurances for this Provider.

idsSpecification.name: ProviderInsurance
idsSpecification.elementOrder: InsuranceType, InsuranceClass, CoverageStartDate, CoverageEndDate, RetroactiveDate, PolicyNumber, PrimaryLimit, PrimaryLimitPerClaim, ExcessLimit, ExcessLimitPerClaim, Contact, AgentName, CarrierName, Carrier

include.name: CommonElements
include.appendToElementOrder: ExtendedAttributes, SourceStatusCode, SourceCreatedDate, SourceCreatedBy, SourceModifiedDate, SourceModifiedBy

idsSpecification.documentation: Use this specification to feed Provider Insurance information into OmniPatient. This specification is essentially the relevant coverage and policy information and a link to the actual insurance company providing the insurance.

element.name: InsuranceType
element.documentation: Use this element to specify the type of insurance.

element.name: InsuranceClass
element.documentation: Use this element to specify the class of insurance.

element.name: CoverageStartDate
element.documentation: Use this element to specify the date that the this coverage started.

element.name: CoverageEndDate
element.documentation: Use this element to specify the date that the this coverage ended.

element.name: RetroactiveDate
element.documentation: Use this element to specify the date that the this coverage is retroactive to.

element.name: PolicyNumber
element.documentation: Use this element to specify the policy number for this insurance.

element.name: PrimaryLimit
element.documentation: Use this element to specify the total limit for this coverage.

element.name: PrimaryLimitPerClaim
element.documentation: Use this element to specify the per claim limit for this coverage.

element.name: ExcessLimit
element.documentation: Use this element to specify the total excess limit for this coverage.

element.name: ExcessLimitPerClaim
element.documentation: Use this element to specify the per claim limit for this coverage. This will be the maximum amount when all underlying policies are totally exhausted. Note: This should not be the Umbrella insurance limit since that is actually another insurance policy.

element.name: Contact
element.documentation: Use this element to specify the contact person who knows/manages this Provider insurance record. This contact should have knowledge of the Provider as well as the Carrier and be able to answer relevant questions.

element.name: AgentName
element.documentation: Use this element to specify the agent contact name at the specified Carrier. This is the person external to the organization unlike the Contact.

element.name: CarrierName
element.documentation: Use this element to specify the Insurance carrier name. Do not use this element if are using the Carrier element as that should contain the legal name of the carrier.

element.name: Carrier
element.documentation: Use this element to link to the Organization that is providing insurance for this Provider.

list.name: Languages
list.documentation: Use this collection to specify the set of Languages the Provider has some level of proficiency in.

idsSpecification.name: ProviderLanguage

include.name: CommonElements
include.appendToElementOrder: ExtendedAttributes, SourceStatusCode, SourceCreatedDate, SourceCreatedBy, SourceModifiedDate, SourceModifiedBy

idsSpecification.documentation:
Use this collection element to specify one or more possible languages that the Provider has some level of proficiency in. Each language will allow ability (Read, Write, etc) as well as proficiency (Excellent, Good, etc) to be specified.
The InterpreterPrivilege will allow specification of the locations where the Provider may be used to interpret for the language specified.

element.name: Language
element.documentation: Use this element to specify the language that the Provider has ability to understand.

element.name: Ability
element.documentation: Use this element to specify ability (Read, Write, etc) the Provider possesses with respect to the language.

element.name: Proficiency
element.documentation: Use this element to to specify the level of proficiency (Good, Bad, etc) the Provider possesses with respect to the language ability.

list.name: InterpreterPrivileges
list.documentation: Use this collection to specify the locations (Facilities) that this Provider may be used as an interpreter for the specified language.

idsSpecification.name: ProviderInterpreterPrivilege

include.name: CommonElements
include.appendToElementOrder: ExtendedAttributes, SourceStatusCode, SourceCreatedDate, SourceCreatedBy, SourceModifiedDate, SourceModifiedBy

idsSpecification.documentation: Use this collection element to specify the location that a Provider may provide interpretation services.

element.name: Location
element.documentation: Use this element to specify a link to the Facility where the Provider may provider interpreter services for the specified Language.

list.name: Educations
list.documentation: Use this collection to specify the set of Education that the Provider has completed or is currently active.

idsSpecification.name: ProviderEducation
idsSpecification.elementOrder: Type, DegreeGranted, DegreeGrantedDate, DegreeStartDate, DegreeEndDate, InstitutionName, Institution, Specialization, Fee, ClassRank, ClassCount, ClassPercentile

include.name: CommonElements
include.appendToElementOrder: ExtendedAttributes, SourceStatusCode, SourceCreatedDate, SourceCreatedBy, SourceModifiedDate, SourceModifiedBy

idsSpecification.documentation: Use this structure to specify education information for the Provider.

element.name: Type
element.documentation: This field contains the categorization of the education. (i.e. Graduate, Medical, etc)

element.name: DegreeGranted
element.documentation: This field contains the standard classification awarded upon completion of a unified program of study

element.name: DegreeGrantedDate
element.documentation: This field contains the date the academic degree was granted to the staff member.

element.name: DegreeStartDate
element.documentation: This field contains the date when the academic degree program started.

element.name: DegreeEndDate
element.documentation: This field contains the date when the academic degree program ended.

element.name: InstitutionName
element.documentation: This field contains the official name of the academic institution that granted the degree to the Staff Member. This should not be used if you intend to supply a link to the actual School.

element.name: Institution
element.documentation: Use this element to define the educational institution the Provider attended.

element.name: Specialization
element.documentation: This field contains the subject of academic study associated with the specific academic degree program pursued by the staff member as his/her area of specialization.

element.name: Fee
element.documentation: Use this element to specify the amount paid to receive this education.

element.name: ClassRank
element.documentation: Use this element to specify the rank of the Provider while receiving this education.

element.name: ClassCount
element.documentation: Use this element to specify the student count while receiving this education.

element.name: ClassPercentile
element.documentation: Use this element to specify the student class percentile while receiving this education.

list.name: Specialities
list.documentation: Use this collection to specify the set of specialities linked to this Provider.

idsSpecification.name: ProviderSpeciality
idsSpecification.elementOrder: SpecialityType, SpecialityClassification, StartDate, EndDate, PracticingSpecialities, PrimaryIndicator

include.name: CommonElements
include.appendToElementOrder: ExtendedAttributes, SourceStatusCode, SourceCreatedDate, SourceCreatedBy, SourceModifiedDate, SourceModifiedBy

idsSpecification.documentation: Use this collection element to specify one or more Provider specialities.

element.name: SpecialityType
element.documentation: This field contains the segment of the population that a health care provider chooses to service, a specific medical service, a specialization in treating a specific disease, or any other descriptive characteristic about the provider's practice relating to the services rendered of the practitioner at a specific organization unit, for example, Mental Health

element.name: SpecialityClassification
element.documentation: ANSI ASC X12 Health Care Provider Taxonomy, Level 2 - Classification

element.name: StartDate
element.documentation: This field contains the date in which the practitioner earned this speciality.

element.name: EndDate
element.documentation: This field contains the date in which the practitioner ended this speciality.

list.name: PracticingSpecialities
list.documentation: Use this collection to link specialities that the Provider is currently practicing.

idsSpecification.name: ProviderPracticeSpeciality
idsSpecification.elementOrder: Specialization, SpecializationDescription, StartDate, EndDate, Facility, EmploymentStatus, PracticeFacility, ProviderPractice, OrganizationUnit,PrimaryOrganizationIndicator, BoardApprovalIndicator, PrimaryCareIndicator, AcceptingNewPatients, AcceptingWalkIns, SupervisingProvider, SupervisionRequired

include.name: CommonElements
include.appendToElementOrder: ExtendedAttributes, SourceStatusCode, SourceCreatedDate, SourceCreatedBy, SourceModifiedDate, SourceModifiedBy

idsSpecification.documentation: Use this collection element to specify one or more Provider specialities that are currenly being practiced.

element.name: Specialization
element.documentation: Use this element to specify the specialization that the Provider is practicing at the facility.

element.name: SpecializationDescription
element.documentation: Use this element to specify notes on this specific specific specialization.
element.example: Provider has very good outcomes for Heart Valve Replacements.

element.name: StartDate
element.documentation: This field contains the date in which the practitioner started working at the specific organization unit in the specific practicing specialty category.

element.name: EndDate
element.documentation: This field contains the date in which the practitioner ended working at the specific organization unit in the specific practicing specialty category.

element.name: Facility
element.documentation:
DEPRECATED: Please use the PracticeFacility data element, which provides better granularity on the specific Practice Facility.
Use this element to specify the location where this specialty is being practiced.

element.name: OrganizationUnit
element.documentation: This field contains the organization unit, as defined by the organization owning the Facility.

element.name: PrimaryOrganizationIndicator
element.documentation: This field contains an indicator for whether this organization unit is the primary organization unit for this practitioner.

element.name: EmploymentStatus
element.documentation: This field contains a code indicating the working relationship of the practitioner at this organization.

element.name: ProviderPractice
element.documentation: Use this element to specify the ProviderPractice for whom this specialty is being practiced.

element.name: PracticeFacility
element.documentation: Use this element to specify the location where this specialty is being practiced.

element.name: BoardApprovalIndicator
element.documentation: This field contains an indicator for whether this practice specialty requires board approval.

element.name: PrimaryCareIndicator
element.documentation: This field contains an indicator for whether this practice specialty may act as a primary care physician (PCP).

element.name: AcceptingNewPatients
element.documentation: Use this element to specify if the provider is accepting new patients at the facility where practicing a specific specialty.

element.name: AcceptingWalkIns
element.documentation: Use this element to specify if the provider is accepting walk-ins at the facility where practicing a specific specialty.

element.name: SupervisingProvider
element.documentation: Use this element to specify if the provider can supervise others at the facility where practicing a specific specialty.

element.name: SupervisionRequired
element.documentation: Use this element to specify if the provider requires supervision at the facility where practicing a specific specialty.

element.name: PrimaryIndicator
element.documentation: Use this element to specify the provider's primary indicator.

list.name: Certifications
list.documentation:
Use this collection to specify the set of certifications earned by this Provider.
Certification attests to the education, skills, and training of a Provider, and recognition is achieved through testing for standard knowledge by examination.
Licensure via individual state regulations is granted after certification and recognizes a provider's unique, highly developed skill set and ability to provide patient care.
Credentialing and privileging follows licensure and is the process through which a provider obtains authorization to practice in a health care setting.

idsSpecification.name: ProviderCertification
idsSpecification.elementOrder: CertificationType, Subject, GrantingInformation, SerialNumber, Jurisdiction, ActiveDate, InactiveDate, ExpirationDate, RenewalDate, RevocationDate, RevocationReason

include.name: CommonElements
include.appendToElementOrder: ExtendedAttributes, SourceStatusCode, SourceCreatedDate, SourceCreatedBy, SourceModifiedDate, SourceModifiedBy

idsSpecification.documentation: Use this structure to specify one or more Provider certifications.

element.name: CertificationType
element.documentation: Use this field to specify the certification type.

element.name: Subject
element.documentation: This field defines the name of the subject of the certificate as used by the certifying body.

group.name: GrantingInformation
group.documentation: This element contains information regarding the granting authority and privilege locations for the certification.

element.name: Authority
element.documentation: Use this element to link to the Organization that granted this certificate to the Provider.

element.name: Date
element.documentation: This field contains the date when the certification was granted.

element.name: Country
element.documentation: Use this element to specify the country that the certification is granted for.

element.name: StateProvince
element.documentation: Use this element to specify the state/province the certification was granted for.

element.name: CountyRegion
element.documentation: Use this element to specify the county/region the certification was granted for.

element.name: SerialNumber
element.documentation: This field contains the number and/or characters that identify the certificate held by the health professional.

group.name: Jurisdiction
group.documentation: This element contains information regarding the jurisdiction for the certification of privilege.

element.name: Country
element.documentation: This field contains the country for which the qualification is valid.

element.name: StateProvince
element.documentation: This field contains the state for which the qualification is valid

element.name: CountyRegion
element.documentation: This field contains the county/parish for which the qualification is valid.

element.name: Breadth
element.documentation: This field contains the breadth/extent of the jurisdiction where the qualification is valid.

element.name: ActiveDate
element.documentation: This field contains the date/time when the certificate became or will become active.

element.name: InactiveDate
element.documentation: This field contains the date/time when the certificate became or will become inactive.

element.name: ExpirationDate
element.documentation: This field contains the date/time when the certificate expires or will expire.

element.name: RenewalDate
element.documentation: This field contains the date/time when the certificate must/will/ be / has been renewed.

element.name: RevocationDate
element.documentation: This field contains the date/time when the certificate has been revoked.

element.name: RevocationReason
element.documentation: This field contains the reason for revoking the certificate (e.g., having been compromised, changes of conditions/environment, etc.)

list.name: Licenses
list.documentation:
Use this element to specify the licenses that were granted to this Provider.
Licensure via individual state regulations is granted after certification and recognizes a provider's unique, highly developed skill set and ability to provide patient care.

idsSpecification.name: ProviderLicense
idsSpecification.elementOrder: LicenseType, LicenseNumber, IssuedDate, ExpirationDate, RenewalDate, LicensingAuthority, PracticingLicenses

include.name: CommonElements
include.appendToElementOrder: ExtendedAttributes, SourceStatusCode, SourceCreatedDate, SourceCreatedBy, SourceModifiedDate, SourceModifiedBy

idsSpecification.documentation:
Use this structure to specify License information for the Provider.
Licensure via individual state regulations is granted after certification and recognizes a provider's unique, highly developed skill set and ability to provide patient care.
Note: This is the list of possible licenses the Provider may practice, not what they are actually practicing.

element.name: LicenseType
element.documentation: Use this element to specify the type of license.

element.name: LicenseNumber
element.documentation: Use this element to specify the license number.

element.name: IssuedDate
element.documentation: Use this element to specify date the license was issued.

element.name: ExpirationDate
element.documentation: Use this element to specify date the license will Expire.

element.name: RenewalDate
element.documentation: Use this element to specify date the license will require renewal.

element.name: LicensingAuthority
element.documentation: Use this element to specify the authority that issues to license.

list.name: PracticingLicenses
list.documentation: Use this element to specify the facilities where the Provider is currently practicing.

idsSpecification.name: ProviderPracticeLicense
idsSpecification.elementOrder: LicenseType, StartDate, EndDate, VerificationStatus, VerificationMethod, VerifiedBy, VerifiedDate, VerificationComment, Facility, CredentialStatus, LicenseMonitoring

include.name: CommonElements
include.appendToElementOrder: ExtendedAttributes, SourceStatusCode, SourceCreatedDate, SourceCreatedBy, SourceModifiedDate, SourceModifiedBy

idsSpecification.documentation:
Use this element to specify information about what a Provider is licensed to practice at a specified Facility.
Defines what the provider is currently practicing. [Medicine, Paramedic, Cardiaoligist].

element.name: LicenseType
element.documentation: Use this element to specify the type of license. This may be the same as the parent license or a sub-classification underneath that license.

element.name: StartDate
element.documentation: Use this element to specify when the Practice License for the Facility will be in effect.

element.name: EndDate
element.documentation: Use this element to specify when the Practice License for the Facility will be terminate.

element.name: VerificationStatus
element.documentation: Use this element to specify the status of the Credential. Verification will be periodic process to insure the Provider should continue to have this license to practice at the facility.

element.name: VerificationMethod
element.documentation: Use this element to specify how the verification was conducted. When this verification is complete the CredentialStatus should also be known.

element.name: VerifiedBy
element.documentation: Use this element to specify the user id or name of the person who performed the verification.

element.name: VerifiedDate
element.documentation: Use this element to specify the user id or name of the person who performed the verification.

element.name: VerificationComment
element.documentation: Use this element to capture comments from the person performing the verification.
element.example: Reviewed records and all appears to be in order.

element.name: Facility
element.documentation: Specify the facility that the Provider is licensed to practicing at.

element.name: CredentialStatus
element.documentation: Use this element to specify the status of credentials for this license. You may also use RelatedCredential to link the Credential if known.

list.name: LicenseMonitoring
list.documentation: Specifies the list of monitor records.

idsSpecification.name: ProviderLicenseMonitor

include.name: CommonElements
include.appendToElementOrder: ExtendedAttributes, SourceStatusCode, SourceCreatedDate, SourceCreatedBy, SourceModifiedDate, SourceModifiedBy

idsSpecification.documentation: Use this specification to feed license monitor records for a PracticingLicense. This is simply an activity log of when and who monitored the license. A practice license may be monitored multiple times a year.

element.name: MonitoringDate
element.documentation: Use this element to specify when the monitoring occured.

element.name: MonitoringOutcome
element.documentation: Description of the outcome of this monitoring record.

element.name: OutcomeDescription
element.documentation: Detailed description of the outcome of this monitoring record.

list.name: Credentials
list.documentation: Use this element to specify the credentials that were granted to this Provider.

idsSpecification.name: ProviderCredential

include.name: CommonElements
include.appendToElementOrder: ExtendedAttributes, SourceStatusCode, SourceCreatedDate, SourceCreatedBy, SourceModifiedDate, SourceModifiedBy

idsSpecification.documentation: A Credential is issued after a Provider has been Certified and Licensed. A Credential will allow a Provider to work within a specific Hospital setting.
idsSpecification.backgroun:
A Credential is issued after a Provider has been Certified and Licensed. A Credential will allow a Provider to work with a specific Hospital setting.
John,
I went the web and got a decent answer… http://www.medscape.com/viewarticle/723679
From Article: Certification attests to the education, skills, and training of a Provider, and recognition is achieved through testing for standard knowledge by examination. Licensure via individual state regulations is granted after certification and recognizes a provider's unique, highly developed skill set and ability to provide patient care. Credentialing and privileging follows licensure and is the process through which a provider obtains authorization to practice in hospital settings.
So it looks like process is: Education -> Certification -> Licensing -> Credentialing
Does this look correct? JOHN WAS AFFIRMATIVE
Hope this helps, they are different. Let’s spend two hours a day together next week.
What is credentialing? Credentialing is a systematic approach to the collection and verification of a provider's professional qualifications. The qualifications that are reviewed and verified include, but are not limited to, relevant training, licensure, certification and/or registration to practice in a health care field, and academic background. Additionally, Aetna conducts an assessment of whether the provider meets certain criteria relating to professional competence and conduct.
HEALTH CARE PROVIDER CERTIFICATE PROCESS: Initial Application: Applications for a health care provider certificate are submitted along with a $1,000 non-refundable application fee. After the application is reviewed and deemed complete, the applicant is notified to contact the agency in writing for an on-site initial survey.
Initial Survey: The on-site review for a health care provider certificate is conducted to assure compliance with Florida Statute and rule. The initial review covers the following areas: • Governing Body • Medical Records System • Quality of Care • Quality Assurance Program • Referral procedures • Internal Risk Management • Credentialing • Grievance Procedure • Provider Network • Advance Directives • Member Handbooks and/or Subscriber Agreements If found to be in compliance, the Agency issues a Health Care Provider Certificate (HCPC) indicating the counties or parts of counties for which the applicant has been approved.
Renewal: The HCPC is renewed biannually upon submission of an application for renewal and a $1,000 non-refundable application fee. Upon receipt of an application for renewal, the provider network is reviewed for compliance with Florida Statute and rule.
Monitoring: Ongoing monitoring is accomplished through quarterly and annual grievance reports, annual risk management surveys, complaint information from the HMO Complaint Hotline, and investigations of subscriber quality of care complaints. In addition, HMOs are required to maintain accreditation from a nationally recognized accreditation organization approved by the Agency. Expansions: An HMO or prepaid health clinic may expand their geographic service area by submitting an expansion affidavit. When the affidavit is reviewed and deemed complete, a desk review is completed to review the provider network the health plan will use in the expanded area. The affidavit also affirms consistent compliance throughout the expanded network with Florida Statute and rule.
Accreditation: Accreditation is a process to measure how a health care organization performs using a nationally recognized set of quality standards. By looking at internal processes of monitoring and evaluating the health care given to members of health maintenance organizations, members are assured of quality services rendered in the most cost effective manner. Since 1992, Florida has required HMOs to be accredited by a nationally recognized accreditation organization whose standards have been approved by the Agency

element.name: Credential
element.documentation: Use this element specify the credential identifier. This identifier should be supplied by the IssuingAuthority.

element.name: CredentialingAuthority
element.documentation: Use this element to link to the credential issuing organization. This will typically be the Hospital that the Provider will be providing service.

element.name: Facility
element.documentation: Specify the facility where the Provider is allowed to work given this credential.

list.name: Privileges
list.documentation: Use this element to specify the privileges the Provider has been given for a set of facilities. These privileges are used to make assignments to the Provider.

idsSpecification.name: ProviderPrivilege
idsSpecification.elementOrder: Privilege, OutpatientOrderingProvider, StartDate, EndDate, RevokedDate, Comment, Facility, Assignments

include.name: CommonElements
include.appendToElementOrder: ExtendedAttributes, SourceStatusCode, SourceCreatedDate, SourceCreatedBy, SourceModifiedDate, SourceModifiedBy

idsSpecification.documentation: This entity defines permissions (privileges) granted to a Provider by a hospital governing board to provide patient care in the hospital. The governing board must insure that the Provider has proper Licensing and Credentials to perform the granted permission.

element.name: Privilege
element.documentation: Use this element to specify the privilege for this Provider at the specified Facility. Example: Admitting, Clinical, Conversion, Emergency, Hospital, Staff, Temporary, Therapeutic, e-Prescribe

element.name: OutpatientOrderingProvider
element.documentation: Use this element to specify if the provider can place orders on outpatients at the facility.

element.name: StartDate
element.documentation: Use this element to specify when the privilege at the facility begins.

element.name: EndDate
element.documentation: Use this element to specify when the privilege ends.

element.name: RevokedDate
element.documentation: Use this element to specify the date that this privilege was revoked.

element.name: Comment
element.documentation: Use this element to specify comments regarding this privilege.

element.name: Facility
element.documentation: Use this element to define the Facility where the Provider has this Privilege. This is physical facility while the assignment will indicate where in the Facility the actual service will/has been rendered.

list.name: Assignments
list.documentation: Use this collection to link Provider detailed assignments at the facility to where they are Privileged to work.

idsSpecification.name: ProviderAssignment
idsSpecification.elementOrder: AssignmentType, StartDate, EndDate, AssignmentStatus, AssignmentStatusDate, MedicalGroup, PrimarySpeciality, TerminationDate, TerminationReason, AllowedToSeePatients, WorkHours, AcceptingPatients, PointOfService

include.name: CommonElements
include.appendToElementOrder: ExtendedAttributes, SourceStatusCode, SourceCreatedDate, SourceCreatedBy, SourceModifiedDate, SourceModifiedBy

idsSpecification.documentation:
This entity defines an actual work assignment, which includes time frame and location at the Facility that the Provider will or has rendered service. This entity must always be a child of a ProviderPrivilege.
Example: Provider may be assigned to perform admittance M-F 8:00-5:00pm at Hospital A on ward B.

element.name: AssignmentType
element.documentation: Use this element to specify the type of assignment. This type of assignment should be consistent with the parent ProviderPrivilege.

element.name: StartDate
element.documentation: Use this element to specify when the assignment will begin at the specified Facility.

element.name: EndDate
element.documentation: This field contains the date in which the practitioner ended working at the specific organization unit in the specific practicing specialty category.

element.name: AssignmentStatus
element.documentation: Use this element to specify the status of this assignment.

element.name: AssignmentStatusDate
element.documentation: Use this element to specify the date that the status was updated.

element.name: PrimarySpeciality
element.documentation: Use this element to specify the primary speciality required for this assignment.

element.name: MedicalGroup
element.documentation: Use this element to link this assignment to a MedicalGroup. This medical group can then be used to aggregate information about Providers at a Facility.

element.name: TerminationDate
element.documentation: Use this element to specify when this assignment was abnormally terminated.

element.name: TerminationReason
element.documentation: Use this element to specify the reason for abnormal termination.

element.name: AllowedToSeePatients
element.documentation: Use this element to specify if the Provider may see Patients.

element.name: WorkHours
element.documentation: Use this element to specify the hours expected to provide service at the specified location.

element.name: AcceptingPatients
element.documentation: Use this element to specify if the Provider is accepting new patients.

element.name: PointOfService
element.documentation: Use this element to specify the actual service contact point within the facility.

list.name: Overrides
list.documentation: Use this collection to specify manual overrides between this object and the specified object.

idsSpecification.name: ProviderManualOverride

include.name: CommonElements
include.appendToElementOrder: ExtendedAttributes, SourceStatusCode, SourceCreatedDate, SourceCreatedBy, SourceModifiedDate, SourceModifiedBy

idsSpecification.documentation: Use this IDS to force a specific manual override between providers in Omni. The processing of the override will be specific to the OverrideType and Providers specified.

element.name: OverrideType
element.documentation: Use this element to specify what type of manual override should be performed between the this Provider and the OtherProvider specified.

element.name: OtherProvider
element.documentation: Use this element to specify the other Provider effected by this manual override request.
